text: He stood at the gate and watched from afar as the squadron, still carrying the white baton, cleaned the newborn. The baby, each time soap was poured into his eyes, rubbed his face tenderly. She also cried with a very shrill voice. While he noticed an odor that reminded him of a mouse, he could not avoid certain lofty and profound ideas rushing into his mind... Why had this child come into the world? In this world full of pain... Why would you carry the burden of having a father like me? It was the first child to be given to his wife. FIN Life of an Idiot, 1927
title: Parto
author: Ryunosuke Akutagawa
